TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract PipeStream extends System.IO.Stream

Docs.summary: Exposes a <see cref="T:System.IO.Stream"> object around a pipe, which supports both anonymous and named pipes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The PipeStream class provides the base class for named and anonymous pipes operations in the .NET Framework. Use the <xref:System.IO.Pipes.NamedPipeServerStream> and <xref:System.IO.Pipes.NamedPipeClientStream> classes for named pipe operations. Use the <xref:System.IO.Pipes.AnonymousPipeServerStream> and <xref:System.IO.Pipes.AnonymousPipeClientStream> classes for anonymous pipe operations.
For more information about pipes, see [Pipes](../Topic/Pipe%20Operations%20in%20the%20.NET%20Framework.md). For an example of anonymous pipes, see [How to: Use Anonymous Pipes for Local Interprocess Communication](../Topic/How%20to:%20Use%20Anonymous%20Pipes%20for%20Local%20Interprocess%20Communication.md). For an example of named pipes, see [How to: Use Named Pipes for Network Interprocess Communication](../Topic/How%20to:%20Use%20Named%20Pipes%20for%20Network%20Interprocess%20Communication.md).

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.IO.Pipes.PipeDirection direction, int32 bufferSize) cil managed

Docs.param: One of the <see cref="T:System.IO.Pipes.PipeDirection"> values that indicates the direction of the pipe object.
A positive <see cref="T:System.Int32"> value greater than or equal to 0 that indicates the buffer size.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream"> class using the specified <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeDirection> value and buffer size.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor uses a pipe transmission mode of <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeTransmissionMode>.

MemberSignature.Value: protected PipeStream (System.IO.Pipes.PipeDirection direction, System.IO.Pipes.PipeTransmissionMode transmissionMode, int outBufferSize);

.method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.IO.Pipes.PipeDirection direction, valuetype System.IO.Pipes.PipeTransmissionMode transmissionMode, int32 outBufferSize) cil managed

Docs.param: One of the <see cref="T:System.IO.Pipes.PipeDirection"> values that indicates the direction of the pipe object.
One of the <see cref="T:System.IO.Pipes.PipeTransmissionMode"> values that indicates the transmission mode of the pipe object.
A positive <see cref="T:System.Int32"> value greater than or equal to 0 that indicates the buffer size.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream"> class using the specified <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeDirection>, <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeTransmissionMode>, and buffer size.

MemberSignature.Value: public override IAsyncResult BeginRead (byte[] buffer, int offset, int count, AsyncCallback callback, object state);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.IAsyncResult BeginRead(unsigned int8[] buffer, int32 offset, int32 count, class System.AsyncCallback callback, object state) cil managed

Docs.param: The buffer to read data into.
The byte offset in at which to begin reading.
The maximum number of bytes to read.
The method to call when the asynchronous read operation is completed.
A user-provided object that distinguishes this particular asynchronous read request from other requests.
Docs.summary: Begins an asynchronous read operation.
Docs.returns: An <see cref="T:System.IAsyncResult"> object that references the asynchronous read.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Pass the returned <xref:System.IAsyncResult> object to the <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream.EndRead%2A> method to determine how many bytes were read and to release operating system resources used for reading. <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream.EndRead%2A> must be called once for every call to BeginRead. This can be done either in the same code that called BeginRead or in a callback that is passed to BeginRead.
Use the <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream.CanRead%2A> property to determine whether the current <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream> object supports read operations.
If the pipe is closed or an invalid argument is passed to BeginRead, the appropriate exceptions are raised immediately. Errors that occur during an asynchronous read request occur on the thread pool thread that is performing the request. The exceptions are raised when the code calls the <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream.EndRead%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: public override IAsyncResult BeginWrite (byte[] buffer, int offset, int count, AsyncCallback callback, object state);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.IAsyncResult BeginWrite(unsigned int8[] buffer, int32 offset, int32 count, class System.AsyncCallback callback, object state) cil managed

Docs.param: The buffer that contains the data to write to the current stream.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin copying bytes to the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to write.
The method to call when the asynchronous write operation is completed.
A user-provided object that distinguishes this particular asynchronous write request from other requests.
Docs.summary: Begins an asynchronous write operation.
Docs.returns: An <see cref="T:System.IAsyncResult"> object that references the asynchronous write operation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream.EndWrite%2A> must be called once for every call to BeginWrite. This can be done either in the same code that called BeginWrite or in a callback that is passed to BeginWrite.
Use the <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream.CanWrite%2A> property to determine whether the current <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream> object supports write operations.
If the pipe is closed or an invalid argument is passed to BeginWrite, the appropriate exceptions are raised immediately. Errors that occur during an asynchronous write request occur on the thread pool thread that is performing the request. The exceptions are raised when the code calls the <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream.EndWrite%2A> method.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current stream supports read operations.
Docs.value: `true` if the stream supports read operations; otherwise, `false`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream> object is closed, this property returns `false`.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current stream supports seek operations.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream> object is closed, this property returns `false`.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current stream supports write operations.
Docs.value: `true` if the stream supports write operations; otherwise, `false`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream> object is closed, this property returns `false`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyorassemblyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void CheckPipePropertyOperations() cil managed

Docs.summary: Verifies that the pipe is in a proper state for getting or setting properties.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyorassemblyhidebysig instance void CheckReadOperations() cil managed

Docs.summary: Verifies that the pipe is in a connected state for read operations.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyorassemblyhidebysig instance void CheckWriteOperations() cil managed

Docs.summary: Verifies that the pipe is in a connected state for write operations.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void Dispose(bool disposing) cil managed

Docs.param: `true` to release both managed and unmanaged resources; `false` to release only unmanaged resources.
Docs.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the <see cref="T:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream"> class and optionally releases the managed resources.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is called by the public <xref:System.ComponentModel.Component.Dispose%2A> method and the <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method. <xref:System.ComponentModel.Component.Dispose%2A> invokes the protected Dispose method with the parameter set to `true`. <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> invokes Dispose with set to `false`. When the disposing parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream> object references. This method invokes the Dispose method of each referenced object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 EndRead(class System.IAsyncResult asyncResult) cil managed

Docs.param: The reference to the pending asynchronous request.
Docs.summary: Ends a pending asynchronous read request.
Docs.returns: The number of bytes that were read. A return value of 0 indicates the end of the stream (the pipe has been closed).

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method returns the number of bytes read into the byte array specified by the earlier call to <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream.BeginRead%2A>.
Pass the returned <xref:System.IAsyncResult> object to the EndRead method to determine how many bytes were read and to release operating system resources used for reading. EndRead must be called once for every call to <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream.BeginRead%2A>. This can be done either in the same code that called <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream.BeginRead%2A> or in a callback that is passed to <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream.BeginRead%2A>.
Use the <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream.CanRead%2A> property to determine whether the current <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream> object supports read operations.
If the pipe is closed or an invalid argument is passed to <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream.BeginRead%2A>, the appropriate exceptions are raised immediately. Errors that occur during an asynchronous read request occur on the thread pool thread that is performing the request. The exceptions are raised when the code calls the EndRead method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void EndWrite(class System.IAsyncResult asyncResult) cil managed

Docs.param: The reference to the pending asynchronous request.
Docs.summary: Ends a pending asynchronous write request.

remarks.format:
## Remarks EndWrite must be called once for every call to <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream.BeginWrite%2A>. This can be done either in the same code that called <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream.BeginWrite%2A> or in a callback that is passed to <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream.BeginWrite%2A>.
Use the <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream.CanWrite%2A> property to determine whether the current <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream> object supports write operations.
If the pipe is closed or an invalid argument is passed to <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream.BeginWrite%2A>, the appropriate exceptions are raised immediately. Errors that occur during an asynchronous write request occur on the thread pool thread that is performing the request. The exceptions are raised when the code the calls EndWrite method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Flush() cil managed

Docs.summary: Clears the buffer for the current stream and causes any buffered data to be written to the underlying device.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Flush method is not supported in the <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream> class and does nothing when it is called.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.IO.Pipes.PipeSecurity GetAccessControl() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a <see cref="T:System.IO.Pipes.PipeSecurity"> object that encapsulates the access control list (ACL) entries for the pipe described by the current <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream> object.
Docs.returns: A <see cref="T:System.IO.Pipes.PipeSecurity"> object that encapsulates the access control list (ACL) entries for the pipe described by the current <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream> object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks An access control list (ACL) describes individuals and/or groups that have, or do not have, rights to perform specific actions on a specified file. For more information, see [How to: Add or Remove Access Control List Entries](../Topic/How%20to:%20Add%20or%20Remove%20Access%20Control%20List%20Entries.md).

Docs.summary: Gets the size, in bytes, of the inbound buffer for a pipe.
Docs.value: An integer value that represents the inbound buffer size, in bytes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If InBufferSize is 0, the buffer size is allocated as needed.

MemberSignature.Value: protected void InitializeHandle (Microsoft.Win32.SafeHandles.SafePipeHandle handle, bool isExposed, bool isAsync);
.method familyhidebysig instance void InitializeHandle(class Microsoft.Win32.SafeHandles.SafePipeHandle handle, bool isExposed, bool isAsync) cil managed

Docs.param: The <see cref="T:Microsoft.Win32.SafeHandles.SafePipeHandle"> object of the pipe to initialize.
`true` to expose the handle; otherwise, `false`.
`true` to indicate that the handle was opened asynchronously; otherwise, `false`.
Docs.summary: Initializes a <see cref="T:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream"> object from the specified <xref:Microsoft.Win32.SafeHandles.SafePipeHandle> object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the pipe is in a connected state, this method also sets the <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream.IsConnected%2A> property to `true`.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a <see cref="T:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream"> object was opened asynchronously or synchronously.
Docs.value: `true` if the <see cref="T:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream"> object was opened asynchronously; otherwise, `false`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property enables your code to use the <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream.SafePipeHandle%2A> property correctly.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IsConnected { get; protected set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a <see cref="T:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream"> object is connected.
Docs.value: `true` if the <see cref="T:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream"> object is connected; otherwise, `false`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The IsConnected property returns `true` only if the <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream> object is connected. If this property returns `false`, the pipe may be waiting to connect, or may be disconnected, closed, or broken.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a handle to a <see cref="T:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream"> object is exposed.
Docs.value: `true` if a handle to the <see cref="T:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream"> object is exposed; otherwise, `false`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value of this property is set when obtaining a handle to the pipe that is encapsulated by the current <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream> object.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether there is more data in the message returned from the most recent read operation.
Docs.value: `true` if there are no more characters to read in the message; otherwise, `false`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is relevant if the pipe's <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream.ReadMode%2A> property was set to <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeTransmissionMode> by the most recent call to <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream.Read%2A> or <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream.EndRead%2A>.

Docs.summary: Gets the length of a stream, in bytes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream> class does not support the Length property.

Docs.summary: Gets the size, in bytes, of the outbound buffer for a pipe.
Docs.value: The outbound buffer size, in bytes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If OutBufferSize is 0, the buffer size is allocated as needed.

MemberSignature.Value: public override long Position { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the current position of the current stream.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream> class does not support the Position property.

MemberSignature.Value: public override int Read (byte[] buffer, int offset, int count);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 Read(unsigned int8[] buffer, int32 offset, int32 count) cil managed

Docs.param: When this method returns, contains the specified byte array with the values between and ( + - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The byte offset in the array at which the bytes that are read will be placed.
The maximum number of bytes to read.
Docs.summary: Reads a block of bytes from a stream and writes the data to a specified buffer.
Docs.returns: The total number of bytes that are read into . This might be less than the number of bytes requested if that number of bytes is not currently available, or 0 if the end of the stream is reached.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream.CanRead%2A> property to determine whether the current <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream> object supports read operations.
Calling the Read method blocks until bytes are read or the end of the stream is reached. For asynchronous read operations, see <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream.BeginRead%2A> and <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream.EndRead%2A>.
## Examples The following example creates an anonymous pipe client and pipe server. The pipe server uses the Read method to read a series of bytes from the pipe client as a validation code. Both the pipe client and the pipe server are part of the same example. The server portion of the example creates a client process and passes it an anonymous pipe handle as an argument.
[!CODE [System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream#1](../CodeSnippet/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.io.pipes.pipestream#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 ReadByte() cil managed

Docs.summary: Reads a byte from a pipe.
Docs.returns: The byte, cast to <see cref="T:System.Int32">, or -1 indicates the end of the stream (the pipe has been closed).

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream.CanRead%2A> property to determine whether the current <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream> object supports read operations.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.IO.Pipes.PipeTransmissionMode ReadMode { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the reading mode for a <see cref="T:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream"> object.
Docs.value: One of the <see cref="T:System.IO.Pipes.PipeTransmissionMode"> values that indicates how the <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream> object reads from the pipe.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Anonymous pipes do not support <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeTransmissionMode> mode message transmission.

Docs.summary: Gets the safe handle for the local end of the pipe that the current <see cref="T:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream"> object encapsulates.
Docs.value: A <see cref="T:Microsoft.Win32.SafeHandles.SafePipeHandle"> object for the pipe that is encapsulated by the current <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream> object.

MemberSignature.Value: public override long Seek (long offset, System.IO.SeekOrigin origin);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance int64 Seek(int64 offset, valuetype System.IO.SeekOrigin origin) cil managed

Docs.param: The point, relative to , to begin seeking from.
Specifies the beginning, the end, or the current position as a reference point for , using a value of type <see cref="T:System.IO.SeekOrigin">.
Docs.summary: Sets the current position of the current stream to the specified value.
Docs.returns: The new position in the stream.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Seek method is not supported in pipes and raises a <xref:System.NotSupportedException> when it is called.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void SetAccessControl(class System.IO.Pipes.PipeSecurity pipeSecurity) cil managed

Docs.param: A <see cref="T:System.IO.Pipes.PipeSecurity"> object that specifies an access control list (ACL) entry to apply to the current pipe.
Docs.summary: Applies the access control list (ACL) entries specified by a <see cref="T:System.IO.Pipes.PipeSecurity"> object to the pipe specified by the current <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream> object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks An access control list (ACL) describes individuals and/or groups that have, or do not have, rights to perform specific actions on a specified file. For more information, see [How to: Add or Remove Access Control List Entries](../Topic/How%20to:%20Add%20or%20Remove%20Access%20Control%20List%20Entries.md).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void SetLength(int64 value) cil managed

Docs.param: The new length of the stream.
Docs.summary: Sets the length of the current stream to the specified value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream> class does not support the SetLength method.

Docs.summary: Gets the pipe transmission mode supported by the current pipe.
Docs.value: One of the <see cref="T:System.IO.Pipes.PipeTransmissionMode"> values that indicates the transmission mode supported by the current pipe.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Anonymous pipes do not support <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeTransmissionMode> mode message transmission.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void WaitForPipeDrain() cil managed

Docs.summary: Waits for the other end of the pipe to read all sent bytes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The WaitForPipeDrain method blocks until the other end of the pipe has read all sent bytes.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void Write (byte[] buffer, int offset, int count);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void Write(unsigned int8[] buffer, int32 offset, int32 count) cil managed

Docs.param: The buffer that contains data to write to the pipe.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin copying bytes to the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to write to the current stream.
Docs.summary: Writes a block of bytes to the current stream using data from a buffer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream.CanWrite%2A> property to determine whether the current <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream> object supports write operations.
Calling the Write method blocks until bytes are read or the end of the stream is reached. For asynchronous read operations, see <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream.BeginWrite%2A> and <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream.EndWrite%2A>.

Docs.param: The byte to write to the stream.
Docs.summary: Writes a byte to the current stream.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream.CanWrite%2A> property to determine whether the current <xref:System.IO.Pipes.PipeStream> object supports write operations.
